sentences.english: When he was giving a lecture, more than ten of his students stood aside respectfully.
sentences.chinese: 他演講時，他的十幾號弟子都畢恭畢敬地立在一旁。

sentences.english: The students behaved respectfully towards the teacher.
sentences.chinese: 學生們畢恭畢敬地對待老師。

sentences.english: Biff has become an auto-detailer, and is now very deferential toward George.
sentences.chinese: 畢夫現在變成了擦車工，對喬治畢恭畢敬。

sentences.english: Not only is there no need to rush off to China cap in hand.
sentences.chinese: 不僅是沒有必要手捧帽子畢恭畢敬地投奔中國。

sentences.english: The women of the south are diminutive, subservient and very polite.
sentences.chinese: 南方的婦女嬌小可愛，畢恭畢敬，很有禮貌。

sentences.english: The PEC said"With all due respect"was fourth in its poll.
sentences.chinese: 該運動稱投票結果顯示“畢恭畢敬”位居第四。

sentences.english: Dressed in a grey trouser suit, Pelosi seemed almost deferential in her manner.
sentences.chinese: 佩洛西穿着灰色的西裝褲，看起來畢恭畢敬的。

sentences.english: He picked up a card with deference.
sentences.chinese: 他畢恭畢敬地揀起一張卡片。

sentences.english: He stands in awe of his superior.
He went cap in hand to the boss and asked for work.
sentences.chinese: 他畢恭畢敬地走到老闆面前請求得到工作。

sentences.english: He asked me, cap in hand, if I could help him out of his financial difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 他畢恭畢敬地問我能不能幫他擺脫財政困難。

sentences.english: If you are respectful , you show respect for someone.
sentences.chinese: 我們家的孩子對長者總是畢恭畢敬。

sentences.english: They were bowed out by the footman.
sentences.chinese: 他們由男僕畢恭畢敬地送出去。

definition: lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
lit. dumb as a wooden chicken (idiom); fig. dumbstruck
anger against a common enemy (idiom); joined in opposition to the same adversary
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
